newsitem.title: GERMANY: Air Zimbabwe plans new Europe flights, seeks gsas.
newsitem.headline: Air Zimbabwe plans new Europe flights, seeks gsas.

text.p: Air Zimbabwe is seeking general cargo sales agents for a planned string of new European flights from this October, the carrier's German cargo sales executive, Carlos Sanchez, said.
The African airline expects to add flights to Amsterdam, Rome, Copenhagen and Zurich this winter, he told Reuters in an interview.
"I can imagine we would work with gsas for a time to start the (cargo) development. There would be gsas for the new countries," he added.
Sanchez said a Copenhagen to Harare flight with a Zurich stopover was planned and a Rome stopover would be added to the Monday London to Harare flight.
An Amsterdam-Frankfurt-Harare flight would replace the existing Frankfurt-Larnaca-Harare Saturday service, he added.
"I could imagine Amsterdam would be a good market and perhaps Scandinavia for telecommunications," he noted.
Textile imports from Zimbabwe to Rome for the Italian fashion industry could also prove attractive air cargo business, he predicted.

A new Munich to Harare route was also under general consideration due to good demand from tour operators in southern Germany for Zimbabwe as a tourist destination as well as a twinning agreement between the two cities, Sanchez said.
Freight demand in southern Germany for Zimbabwe, however, was not particularly strong, he added.
Air Zimbabwe currently flies four times a week to London Gatwick and twice-weekly to Frankfurt with Boeing 767-200 aircraft.
-- Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom. Tel +44 171 542 7706; Fax: 5017
